property.value: Villagers destroying a poppy field in western Afghanistan

note.text: In the 1990s, opium poppy and heroin production flourished in the countryside. Poppy cultivation developed into a major source of income for farmers. However, the majority of the profits from this illegal trade went to the Taliban.
The Taliban banned opium poppy farming in 2000, but trafficking continued, mostly with warehoused opium. The tax on the Afghan-Pakistani trade was a primary source of revenue for the Taliban.
